trans-unit.source: A trigger action that provides functionality for seeking (skipping) to a specified time within the active period of a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.Storyboard"></xref>.
Use a SeekStoryboard action with an <xref:System.Windows.EventTrigger> or a <xref:System.Windows.Trigger> to seek a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Storyboard>.

Note that seek operations do not take the storyboard's <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Timeline.SpeedRatio%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.ParallelTimeline.SlipBehavior%2A> settings into account: the storyboard is treated as though it had a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Timeline.SpeedRatio%2A> of 1 and no <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.ParallelTimeline.SlipBehavior%2A>.

Seeking a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Storyboard> triggers its <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Timeline.CurrentGlobalSpeedInvalidated> and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Timeline.CurrentStateInvalidated> events.

Pause, Resume, Stop, or Otherwise Control a Storyboard Interactively To be able to pause, resume, or otherwise control a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.BeginStoryboard.Storyboard%2A> interactively, set the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.BeginStoryboard.Name%2A> property of its <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.BeginStoryboard> and use a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.ControllableStoryboardAction> object (such as <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.PauseStoryboard>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.ResumeStoryboard>, or <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.StopStoryboard>) to control it by referencing its <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.BeginStoryboard.Name%2A>.

If the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.BeginStoryboard.Name%2A> of <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.BeginStoryboard> is unspecified, the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.BeginStoryboard.Storyboard%2A> cannot be interactively controlled after it is begun.
See [How to: Use Event Triggers to Control a Storyboard After It Starts](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md) for more information.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.SeekStoryboard"></xref> class.
Gets or sets the amount by which the storyboard should move forward or backward from the seek origin <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.SeekStoryboard.Origin*>.
A positive or negative value that specifies the amount by which the storyboard should move forward or backward from the seek origin <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.SeekStoryboard.Origin*>.
Gets or sets the position from which this seek operation's <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.SeekStoryboard.Offset*> is applied.
The position from which this seek operation's <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.SeekStoryboard.Offset*> is applied.

Returns a value that indicates whether the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.SeekStoryboard.Offset*> property of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.SeekStoryboard"></xref> should be serialized.

**true** if the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.SeekStoryboard.Offset*> property of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.SeekStoryboard"></xref> should be serialized; otherwise, **false**.
